question: Which of the following statements are correct regarding the term of the Governor?
option1: A governor holds office for a term of five years
option2: He can resign by addressing a resignation letter to the Prime Minister
option3: He cannot be removed by the President
answer: A governor holds office for a term of five years
explanation: A governor holds office for a term of five years which is subject to the pleasure of the President. He can resign at any time by addressing a resignation letter to the President. The governor has no security of tenure and can be removed by the President at any time.
